Press conference at Russian embassy
articles.content:
Press conference at Russian embassy
   Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- A press conference took place at the Russian embassy here on Thursday to mark the 54th anniversary of the victory of the Soviet people in the great patriotic war.
   Present there were newspaper and news agency reporters in Pyongyang, military attaches and press officials of foreign embassies here.
   Vladimir Dombrovsky, military attach of the Russian embassy, referred to the victory of the soviet people in the patriotic war against fascism and to its significance.

Former U.S. defense secretary's remarks
articles.content:
Former U.S. defense secretary's remarks
   Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a commentary today criticizes the former U.S. defense secretary's remarks underscoring "the need to demonstrate military muscle" and "use deterrent force" against the DPRK as a bravado.
   The United States has left no stone unturned to stifle the DPRK but  everything ended in a failure. What it has not done is gun-firing, the news analyst says.   He continues:   War on the Korean peninsula is not an imaginary one of the future but is becoming a reality.   The DPRK and the U.S. are technically at war.
   Hence, any preemptive strike by the U.S. may trigger off a total war between the DPRK and the U.S.    
  The DPRK will not hesitate  to resolutely counter whatever actions of the United States including "demonstration of its military muscle" or "use of deterrent force" but surely win the war against it.
   The People's Army and the people of Korea will mercilessly strike at and annihilate the enemies who dare attack the DPRK, wherever they are.
   The U.S. war hawks are well advised to behave with discretion,  clearly mindful of this resolution and will of the People's Army and the people of Korea.

articles.content:
Samurais draw swords for reinvasion of Korea
   Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The adoption of the legislation for the implementation of the "Japan-U.S. Defence Cooperation Guidelines" and the decision of the Defence Agency of Japan to deploy two high-speed missile ships in the future are  intended to carry into practice the Japanese reactionaries' ambition for overseas expansion, which is fraught with a great danger.    
   Minju Joson says this in a signed commentary today.
   The news analyst goes on:   Japan's legislation for the implementation of the "Japan-U.S. Defence Cooperation Guidelines" is intended to legally guarantee overseas expansion from A to Z. 
   The Japanese reactionaries' moves  for arms buildup and modernization stem from  the aim to realize their ambition for overseas expansion.   
   They are, in actuality, getting frantic in staging exercises for war of aggression, having rounded off legal and material preparations for overseas expansion. This shows it is a matter of time for them to carry into practice their ambition.
   There is no guarantee that their war of aggression intended for overseas expansion will not inflict unheard-of sufferings and pains on the world people as well as the Asian people as it did in the past.
   If they persistently choose to realise their adventurous ambition, Japan will no longer exist on the earth.

articles.title: Novel "Signal Fire of Pyongyang"
articles.content:
Novel "Signal Fire of Pyongyang"
   Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The Literature and Art Press Group of Korea recently published a full-length novel "Signal Fire of Pyongyang", a serial of a library "immortal guidance".   The novel written by An Tong Chun impressively represents the immortal exploits of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who made sure that Korea hosted the 13th World Festival of Youth and Students and prepared it on the highest level and recorded the most brilliant chapter in the history of the world festival of youth and students.
